name: FieldValue
title: Google
Cloud
Firestore
FieldValue
description:
FieldValue

Represents a change to be made to fields in document data in the Firestore API.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/firestore"

firestore = Google::Cloud::Firestore.new

user_snap = firestore.doc("users/frank").get

# TODO

methods.name: type
title: Google
Cloud
Firestore
FieldValue#type
methods.description: The type of change to make to an individual field in document data.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/firestore"

firestore = Google::Cloud::Firestore.new

# Get a document reference
nyc_ref = firestore.doc "cities/NYC"

field_delete = Google::Cloud::Firestore::FieldValue.delete
field_delete.type #=> :delete

nyc_ref.update({ name: "New York City",
                 trash: field_delete })

methods.name: delete
title: Google
Cloud
Firestore
FieldValue.delete
methods.description: Creates a field value object representing the deletion of a field in document data.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/firestore"

firestore = Google::Cloud::Firestore.new

# Get a document reference
nyc_ref = firestore.doc "cities/NYC"

field_delete = Google::Cloud::Firestore::FieldValue.delete

nyc_ref.update({ name: "New York City",
                 trash: field_delete })

methods.name: server_time
title: Google
Cloud
Firestore
FieldValue.server_time
methods.description: Creates a field value object representing set a fieldâ€™s value to the server timestamp when accessing the document data.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/firestore"

firestore = Google::Cloud::Firestore.new

# Get a document reference
nyc_ref = firestore.doc "cities/NYC"

field_server_time = Google::Cloud::Firestore::FieldValue.server_time

nyc_ref.update({ name: "New York City",
                 updated_at: field_server_time })

returns.description: The server time field value object.
